comment: Be prepared to be confused, he does have an accent but he is understandable. The problem is his teaching method.  When he does board work he is constantly erasing and doing the same problem over again in another way then erasing and doing it over again. You don't really get a clear understanding of how he wants the questions answered.

I have taken him twice. First time was alright, easier subject. Second time, awful. I could go on and on about how bad he is. I give one example. Syllabus clearly states: Test 2: 4.1-4.5. Test 2 was on no such material but the material that was for Test 3. I received 25 on test 2 and a 100 on test 1. I studied alot for test 2, just the wrong stuff.

I took Calculus one with him over the summer. He was hard to understand but wrote everything he said down. He graded fairly and easy. Thanks to his grading system I actually passed, whereas the first time with another professor I failed. Horribly. I recommend him. He'll seem difficult at first but he comes around!

He's a really nice teacher and will help clarify anything you do not understand. He's hard to understand but he writes everything down on the projector. The only problem I had with this is that he constantly forgot to move the paper up to see what he was writing. He grades fairly easy and will give you partial credit for a problem.

Difficult to understand when he's speaking. However if you cannot understand what he is saying, if you pay attention to what he's writing you should be able to understand it. Very nice and intelligent! 3 tests and a final 10% for attendance. Very lenient when it comes to grading, one early mistake will only cause you to lose a few points.

I took differential equations and numerical methods 2 with Dr. Du, and he is awesome. He's very straightforward, flexible, and will clarify if needed. You have to learn your stuff, but I would still say he's an easy grader. Plus he's wicked smart.

Dr. Du is such a nice guy! Your grades are based off of 3 tests and a final. He drops the lowest test grade and always manages to give you credit on any problem. His tests are rather easy. I didn't do any of the homework problems and still managed to get out of the class with a high B. He also offers extra credit. Would take him again & recommend!

This is the 2nd Class I've taken with Dr. Du. He was helpful with explaining very abstract ideas and complex methods. The class consists of 4 projects and tests. The projects are tough, but the tests are essentially what is on the project. You are able to use the programs you wrote for the project on the test. Great professor. Would take again

Dr. Du is an awesome teacher.  If you don't understand him, ask him to repeat or explain it differently and he will.  I think the room he gets assigned hurts his teaching style (Writing on an overhead).  Knows his trig and calculus dead cold.  Absolutely wonderful resource if you use him correctly.
I really enjoyed Diff EQ with Dr. Du. At first it was difficult to understand him, but he basically tells you what is going to be tested. Also the final was optional.

Professor Du is a nice guy; however, I would not recommend his class for calc. He was hard to understand b/c of his slight accent and soft tone even though I sat fairly close to him. His teaching was all over the place & disorganized, and his writing was sloppy. Calc can be a difficult course, but its WAY harder if you have the wrong professor.

Worst professor ever! Does not have any grasp of the English language. Attendance is 10% of grade. Cannot understand him, or read his notes that he puts on the overhead. He is stuck in the stone age as far as technology is concerned. No notes are posted online. Avoid at all costs.  Worst prof I have ever had, bar none!!!!

Horrible!  I sat right up front and I still could not understand him.  He can't be bothered explaining concepts.  He just sits on his high chair and writes on the overhead.  His writing is sloppy and he makes numerous errors.  I have had difficult or hard profs before and math is my major but he just sucks.  Avoid him at all costs.

Hard to understand, sloppy notes, copies straight out of book so no need to really come to class but he requires attendance, not very thorough and one of the most meticulous professors i have ever had when it comes to grading tests.

Dr. Du.. well let's just say if you're not good at math, don't take any of his courses.  Like others have said, he can be difficult to understand at times and he does move quite quick through the sections in each chapter.  But still, he is extremely helpful and dedicated to teaching.  His calc class has ended up pretty easy for me.

Well he definitely was not the professor to teach  me this class.  I tried getting help from him but I discovered in class that was not an option anymore when he indirectly ridiculed me.  If you decide to take him, Good Luck.
He may be great for some but I'm not one who can teach himself. I busted my ass more in this class than I have in the previous 2 years of college and I still had to drop it.

Dr.Du is very helpful but he is kinda hard to understand.Do not sit in the back because you will hardly hear him.I disliked his class because his grades are based on 3things:tests,quizzes,& attendance.I hated the fact that he gave us HW that was not graded.If you are not well rounded in math, he's not the best to take.The last section was the worst

Highly recommended, Very Good Professor, Super Helpful, Study ahead so you are prepard, He always gives you office hours, He takes the time to teach and will explain everything very well. He is very friendly, too.
Great professor highly recommended.

Du knows what he's talking about, and tries to explain it to the best of his ability, and overall he does very well.  Occasionally the accent can become a problem, but if you pay attention, and take notes then you should do well.  It may be because I had him in the summer, but his tests were  easy, and even had bonus points and partial credit.

Boring. Impossible to understand. I just didn't like him. He went really fast and refused to backtrack if someone got lost. He's also not very good at answering questions. Try to avoid him if you can.

Dr. Du is nice, and he's a great mathematician, but he's not a very good teacher. If you're not concentrating on what he's saying it's difficult to understand him. A lot of times he won't understand your questions and will answer something entirely different. But he is always available to help. If math isn't your subject, I'd take someone else.

Dr. Du was a very easy going professor. He was always willing to help out and re-explain something if we didn't understand it and he was generous in letting us correct tests or projects if we didn't do well on them. I enjoyed his class and his teaching style even if I didn't understand what he was talking about half the time

Dr. Du was one of the most amazing instructors I have taken so far. He is a wonderful professor who takes the time out to teach you the basics with out using the calculator. He's test format is very similar to the quiz. I took this course over the summer and don't reget it at all. If you don't study then don't complain!!
Dr. Du is a very nice man, but you can barely understand him.  He grades very easily.  I arrived on my third day with no previous calculus, and got a B from his lessons.  Really knows his stuff.

He should be teaching lower levels of mathematics where the classes are smaller and people are able to understand what the hell he is saying. I wish this class came with a closed caption button, because he is very soft spoken and his accent is too thick to understand. I had to learn calculus by myself, he is a waste of time.

You need to undrstand 2 things about Dr. Du - 1. His tests are really easy. 2. You cant understand a word he says. Basically if your good at calc, by all means take him. If your bad at calc do not take this class, you wont understand a word he says. people on here are NOT Overestimating, I made an A, but i didnt understand him all year.

the worst professor i have ever had and i am a math ed major.  impossible to understand what he says (unless you speak chinese) and he can't understand you either. he will explain something completely different than what you ask. his tests are okay if you study all your notes. he doesn't really teach, he just gives notes and does a lot of examples.
His projects and take home tests were hard, but if you asked him, he'd tell you how to do it.
If it weren't for his accent he would be top notch.  If you can get passed it, he is one of the most best profs at KSU, and genuinely dedicated to helping his students learn.
difficult to understand due to his Chinese accent, but will spend as much time as you need with you to help you
Good teacher, just very hard to understand. If you cant understand his accent at the very begining you never will.

He is a very good professor, gives a lot of extra credits. He seems more focus on students to learn better than just grading. His tests have consistency with his lectures. Make sure that you know the basic concept of each chapter, easy A. His accent? not that bad, you will enjoy his smart jokes.
Dr. Du is very good and gives great reviews before the test and helps you has much as possible
its hard to understand him but you get used to it.  He teaches you how to do things the hard way, but that in turn makes you learn it better
No Comments
I don't know if im taking math or chinese??
This guy is nice but You can't understand a word he is saying
This guy is a good teacher.
